scenario_text.value: Hey, Shuuji. What are you up to?

I’m checking my supplies. You should do the
same with yours.

(Sounds like Shuuji. I’m worried he’s getting
fixated, but maybe I shouldn’t say so.)
(How should I answer him?)
You’re sure into this.
You seem fixated.
You’re sure into this.
You sure are into this, Shuuji.
Well, we’re coming up on the final battle.

It’s a fight we can’t afford to lose. And
after we win it, we can finally go home.
Yeah...you’re right.

So we can’t be too careful getting ready.
Make sure you don’t forget anything, Takuma.
Right. I’ll be careful.

Heheh, listen to me, giving you advice while
I’ve been caught up in my own thoughts.
Oh? Something on your mind?

Yeah. I was just thinking of everything that
happened since we first came here.
You seem fixated.

You seem kind of fixated on this to me,
Shuuji. Maybe a little too much.

Is that what you think? Well, it’s not like
that.

I’ve actually been thinking back on things as
I go. So much has happened since we got here.

It’s funny. A lot of what we went through was
difficult and dangerous...

But looking back now, all I can think of are
the good things.
Is that how it is for you too, Takuma?
(Good question. How do I feel about that?)
I feel the same way.
Not at all.
I feel the same way.

Yes, I feel the same way. I really only
remember the good times.
Strange, right?

It was kinda like a fun camping trip. And we
won’t ever have an adventure like this again.
Plus, I got to meet Lopmon.

Eheheh. I’m happy to have met you too,
Shuuji.
Not at all.

Actually, all I can ever remember are the bad
things.
Oh, huh. Maybe I’m just weird that way.

If we lose, we die. If we win, we leave this
world behind.

I kind of wish time would just stop right
here in this moment. That way...

...there’d be no danger, and I could just
live within my own happy memories.
Shuuji...

Does it surprise you to hear me say that,
Takuma?
(Is it really that surprising?)
No, not really.
Yeah, it’s strange.
No, not really.

No, not really. I feel like I know what
you’re saying.
That’s good, then. Thanks.
Yeah, it’s strange.
Yeah, it’s not like you, Shuuji.

Maybe it’s not, sorry. Anyway, I’ll stop
complaining now.

That’s enough whining. Let me get back into
this.

We are going to make this happen, right,
Lopmon?!
Right!

Win or lose, this is the end. Let’s make sure
we don’t have any regrets.
